required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Meibomian Gland Related Therapy on the Morphology of Meibomian Gland
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Meibomian Gland Related Therapy on the Morphology of Meibomian Gland

brief_summary.textblock: 200 participants at Eye Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University during September, 2020 to November, 2020 will be enrolled in this study. The meibomian gland related therapy are pulsed light therapy and meibomian gland hot compress massage.

clinical_study.why_stopped: An one-month follow-up was completed after the treatment.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: The length of meibomian glands after the treatment.
The area of meibomian glands after the treatment.
The percentage of meibomian glands after the treatment.
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of meibomian glands in %(area of meibomian glands (mm^2) and area of palpebral conjunctiva (mm^2) will be combined to report percentage of meibomian glands in %) are used to assess this outcome measure.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Intense pulsed light therapy and hot compress massage group

intervention.description: Patients with xerophthalmia were treated with intense pulsed light of meibomian gland.
intervention.arm_group_label: Intense pulsed light therapy and hot compress massage group

intervention.description: Patients with xerophthalmia were treated with hot compress massage of meibomian gland.
intervention.arm_group_label: Intense pulsed light therapy and hot compress massage group

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Previously untreated patients with xerophthalmia
Exclusion Criteria:
- No history of ocular surgery and trauma
- Any eye diseases except xerophthalmia
- No treated for xerophthalmia before
- Successful completion of follow-ups

responsible_party.investigator_title: Vice president of Eye Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University
